job_title: Community Relations Coordinator in Tempe, AZ
pros: I only started a couple of months ago, but I am really enjoying working at Donor Network of Arizona! They pay and benefits are good, I feel valued as an employee, the new office is super nice, and I really enjoy working with my team. They have an inspiring mission and it's easy to see how every employee plays their role in achieving it.
cons: No cons at all so far!

job_title: Director of Marketing and Communications in Tempe, AZ
pros: Kind and wonderful people Meaningful mission Creative work Supportive leadership and HR Good benefits Beautiful building
cons: Really don't have any downsides. A joyful place to work - striving hard to save lives.

job_title: ORPC II in Tempe, AZ
pros: There are a few great people there and the mission does help save people.
cons: The positive culture that used to exist is dead or dying. Most team building experiences have been tossed in the trash.

job_title: Organ Referral Preservation Coordinator in Tempe, AZ
pros: The teamwork and support is incredible and unwavering! To be part of saving lives is so rewarding!
cons: Honestly, none! It truly is a wonderful organization to be a part of.

job_title: Bilingual Donor Support Coordinator in Tempe, AZ
pros: Work / Life balance, great schedule if you don't mind 12 hour days 3 to 4 days a week. Great benefits, great pay, meaningful work. Looking forward to advancing into leadership role and maybe management in a few years. Brand new facility with all the amenities! It's like a mid-century vibe with places to hang out. It really is a great place to work.
cons: It can be emotionally taxing but you are helping families at their worst moment. It is satisfying work and has developed so many skills that I use in my life and undoubtable will advance my career in the future.

job_title: Supervisor in Tempe, AZ
pros: What you can do for people is very fulfilling
cons: Favoritism is very clear in some departments.

job_title: Tissue Recovery Technician in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Benefits, building is nice, not sitting behind a desk all day
cons: Very strict, only open to progress from select people, don't make waves, will always go with covering their own behind when waves are made even if the waves are true.

job_title: Manager in Tempe, AZ
pros: Excellent benefits & compensation package and a strong employee focused culture. All employees I've interacted with are so passionate about what we do as an organization.
cons: The work we do is not for everyone, but it is extremely rewarding. If clinical roles aren't your thing, there are plenty of other opportunities to make a difference here.

job_title: Organ Recovery Coordinator in Tucson, AZ
pros:
Family atmosphere 
Forward thinking 
Progressive
cons: None really...I love it and look forward to many more years.

job_title: Organ Coordinator in Phoenix, AZ
pros: The mission is great and you will love it
cons: Work life balance isn't good

review_title: DNA... Where YOU make a difference!
job_title: RDSS Supervisor in San Jose, CA
pros:
- We are blessed to work in the field of generosity. 
- Our Core Values, Passionate, Positivity, and Eagerness are a part of each of us and lived every day. 
- An amazing culture of inclusivity. 
- We get to play a part in making a difference in the lives of donor families and recipients in all that we do. Donor families get the honor of knowing part of their loved one lives on and recipient get a chance at life that was not there before. It is a gift to have a role in this process. 
- Compensation and benefits are competitive and well thought out.
- Continual giving back to the communities we live and work in is an incredible thing to be a part of.
cons: Change can sometimes be a lengthy process.

job_title: Bilingual Donor Support Coordinator in Tempe, AZ
pros:
Positive Environment
Respectful and inclusive
Powerful and rewarding mission facilitating the selfless gifts of donation to save and heal lives
Great compensation for Bilingual employees
Opportunity for work-life balance through considerate schedules
cons: I do not have any cons. It is hard but fulfilling work and it has been great working for DNAZ.

job_title: Donor Family Advocate in Tempe, AZ
pros: Company culture, values, and the ability to help others.
cons: Until today I can't think of a con.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Tucson, AZ
pros: Great company culture, benefits, and pay.
cons: Some departments can be clique-ish

job_title: Ocular Specialty Representative in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Caring Work Environment, Great Communication, Wonderful training programs
cons: There are no Cons to working here

job_title: Tissue Recovery Coordinator in Tempe, AZ
pros: Very in depth training, pays well, great benefits to full time staff, flexibility with the schedule. I have worked for Donor Network for almost five years and I would not stay with the company if I didn't absolutely love it. The tissue department allows for great learning and working opportunities. I came here expecting to use this job as a stepping stone into a career somewhere else and ended up staying because I never grew tired of the place. The management is excellent and the employees love what they do. The biggest thing I love about Donor Network is that they take care of their employees through great benefits, bonuses, company and department activities and more. There isn't a very high turn over rate because this company knows how to keep employees happy.
cons: Sometimes the hours can be long, for the tissue and ocular departments travel is required which means you travel a lot. That being said you aren't usually traveling every day. Pros far out weigh the cons in my opinion.

job_title: Tissue in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Learn a lot and can travel a lot. Decent pay for what you do.
cons: Long hours and never appreciated by management. This could be a wonderful job but the lack of accountability from its directors all the way down to its leads is a joke. Possibly the most immature staff I have ever worked with in my life. Ultimately the company does not care about its employees, you are there to recover tissue at their say at any hour of your shift. They will gladly send you out to another part of state after a 12 hours shift putting both you and others at risk with being so fatigued. The gossip culture is rewarded and they turn a blind eye to the actions of a select few.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Company-wide mission of saving and improving lives is first and foremost. Building elite leadership to drive change and innovation. People that work at DNAZ typically really want to work there as the job communicates values. Wonderful bosses with an incredible culture of helping others.
cons: As a small company the ability to develop professionally and move up the ladder is limited. The industry is also limited which, depending on the job type, might not be as transferable to another location if an employee chooses to move.

review_title: Great cause, decent place to work
job_title: Intern in Phoenix, AZ
pros:
-Paid internship
-Good hours
-Nice people
-Flexible
-Great cause, get to meet amazing people and hear their stories
cons: I care deeply about the cause so I thought it would be great. Unfortunately I didn't get much out of my internship. Wish I had been brought in on more projects or given more responsibility. I did not take much away from my semester at DNAZ, and come to think of it, I haven't used any of the "skills" I learned there post college.

job_title: Hla Technologist in Phoenix, AZ
pros: This company is growing, and fast. There are tons of opportunities to advance and learn. Professional self-development is a cornerstone of the organization. They truly appreciate and support every single one of their employees, every day. Management is consistent and dependable, and will listen to staff and be flexible to individual needs. It is extremely rare to find an organization of this calibur!
cons: Exposure to donor circumstances can be tough emotionally, but the organization provides excellent support for that.

job_title: IT Support in Surprise, AZ
pros: Working for an organization whose primary focus is to save lives is very rewarding and fulfilling.  Everyone here has a purpose to make the most of life.  It is a wonderful place to work!
cons: For anyone living in the west side of the valley, the organization will soon be located in the east valley.  Pretty far, but not too bad depending on where you are in the west valley.
